page.title: 08MUMFORD'S FACTORY WOODSTOCK
page.content: Owen and Mumford's is a factory in Woodstock which makes medical equipment out of plastic and other things. They buy plastic and mould it into syringes, parts of cars and other products. There are a lot of machines which help to mould the plastic and make it into finished goods. They deal a lot in diabetic medical supplies. Their products are sent all over the world. There are 105 people employed in the Woodstock factory. They make 4,500,000 pounds a year The company was started in 1952 by Mr Owen and Mr Mumford.
